Carrie Severson is a writer and storyteller trainer who teaches leaders how to step into their stories and share their lessons. She loves working with individuals in transition who are ready to tell the stories that are hard to tell. Her sweet spot is knowing when her clients are hiding within a story. She works with them to heal their story, write powerful content that speaks right to their ideal audience and create marketing streams that help increase their brand visibility with their stories. She writes about love, health, burnout, harmony and purpose for national media outlets. Throughout her 20-year storytelling career, she has shared stories in magazines and on stages around the country. She can often times be found on a stage sharing stories. You can always find her and her storytelling services at www.carrieseverson.com and in her Facebook Group, The Soulful Storyteller.

Severson Sisters is a non-profit organization headquartered in Phoenix that empowers females. We provide programs and services that help girls ‘Connect to their Inner Super Girl.’ Our mission is to inspire girls to live their life as their authentic, awesome, super self. Severson Sisters plays a role in the lives of Super Girls to help them become confident Super Women who will lead their communities. We do that by offering a creative and supportive program called Super Girl. The Super Girl Program was created to help girls “Connect to their Inner Super Girl.” The program give girls’ self-esteem enhancing tools, tips on how to develop and maintain healthy relationships with their peers and action plans on gossip, peer pressure and bullying.Severson Sisters strives to teach girls the importance of building self-esteem as a fundamental tool that will help develop, enhance and deepen their relationships with other females. By doing this, girls learn how to nurture powerful and healthy relationships in life. This is how Severson Sisters believes they will decrease bullying – by enhancing Super Girls. The Super Girl program is developed by our Advisory Board of field experts. Severson Sisters sells the Super Girl program to schools and trains two of their staff members in the program curriculum. Super Girl is an ongoing after school program and each principle is implemented on a semester basis.Severson Sisters sells the Super Girl program to schools and trains two of their staff members in the program curriculum. Super Girl is an ongoing after school program and each principle is implemented on a semester basis.  The Super Girl program consists of a total of six core principles that can implemented over the course of three years.

Carrie is a masterful storyteller trainer. She helped me to revitalize my writing career after a very long hiatus. I have submitted two pieces to national publications and have more articles planned.  Her Pitching and Publishing course is rich with outlets interested in publishing my work.  Also, included in the course is a high quality tracking sheet to keep my submissions organized.  Carrie has created a system that positions writers for success.  She puts her clients first by consistently creating programs that helps writers grow in their careers. Carrie offers something for the novice, intermediate and advanced writer.  Carrie is the person you need on your team to propel your writing career forward.

summary: Carrie Severson has always been connected to words. As an empath, she didn’t fit in early on in life. She was bullied as a child and had low self-esteem as a result. So she turned to the make believe world of storytelling. She declared herself a writer in her late teens because she wanted to make a difference in the way women treated other women. Her goal has always been to bring harmony to light and help people support one another. She reaches her personal goal in life through her work as a writer and entrepreneurs. She has been a published writer for nearly 20 years. Her byline has appeared in Redbook.com, The Huffington Post, OnMogul.com, The Arizona Republic, So Scottsdale, and many more. In 2011, she launched an empowerment organization for girls called Severson Sisters. The mission is to inspire girls to live more authentically. Carrie and her team of advisors wrote a series of bestselling workbooks called the Super Girl Guide.  Carrie had been honored for her work with Severson Sisters in Glamour magazine, selected by USA Network and NBCUniversal as one of the 2013 “Characters Unite” award winners and was also inaugurated on her high school Wall of Recognition. As a result of the major growth the nonprofit endured, Carrie burned out. She shares how she recovered from burnout with audiences around the country so others can learn from her lessons. In addition to writing herself, Carrie is a personal storyteller trainer and speaker. She teaches inspired entrepreneurs how to share their stories with the world as a way to increase their platforms. When she isn’t writing, or storytelling training, she travels, speaks, cooks, is a Pilates junkie and sits as the board of director’s president for Severson Sisters.
name: Carrie Severson
title: Storyteller Trainer for Women in the World
